lg.l:
S Eint
wol&slong;ton Wolston
bi&slong;chop bischop of
w&ydot;&rrot;ece&slong;tre W&ydot;recestre
&punctelev;
wa&slong; was here of engelonde Engelonde

Swiþ holi man he wa&slong; was al his lif &punctelev;
a&slong;e ase ich me under&slong;tonde understonde
&yogh;wane &YOGH;wane oþur child&rrot;en children oꝛ ornen to plei&yogh; &punctelev; toward churche he drou&yogh;

Of þis b&slong;chop Bri&yogh;tei Bri&yogh;tei &punctelev; seint
wol&slong;ton Wolston
is o&rrot;d&rrot;e ordre nam
Ech aftur oþur a&slong;e ase it fel &punctelev; so þat he p&rrot;eost preost bicam
þe Þe bi&slong;chop vnderfeng him &slong;ethþe &punctelev; and Monek monek him makede iwis

In þe p&rrot;iorie priorie of wirice&slong;tre Wiricestre
&punctelev; þat noble hous and gret is
Sw&ydot;þe wel is o&rrot;d&rrot;e ordre he heold &punctelev; in þat p&rrot;io&rrot;ie priorie

And al is wille wa&slong; was forto pa&ydot;&yogh;e &punctelev; god and &slong;einte seinte
Marie
In none bedde he nolde come &punctelev; ake &yogh;wane oþere &yogh;eoden þarto

bifo&rrot;e Bifore on auter he wolde go &punctelev; his o&rrot;esones oresones
fo&rrot; for
to do
&yogh;wane &YOGH;wane þe dede slep him ouer eode &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng gon
his His heued he wolde legge adoun &punctelev; opon þe harde &slong;ton ston
Ope one grece bifo&rrot;e bifore þe Auter &punctelev; oþur is bok þara vnder do

And liggen ane &slong;tonnde stonnde in dweole Mieng&ydot;ngue &punctelev; al is &slong;lep slep
&slong;cholde scholde beon so

his He nolde p&rrot;eo preo
dawe&slong; dawes in þe w&ydot;ke &punctelev; no þing eten with alle
Ne no word &slong;peken speken bote his beden &punctelev; fo&rrot; nou&yogh;t þat mi&yogh;te bifalle
þe Þe oþur dawes wel lu&ydot;tel &punctelev; and wel lu&ydot;tel he eat al&slong;o also
bote Bote it were a lu&ydot;te potage &punctelev; holde he wolde him þer to

So longue he leouede at
wirece&slong;tre wirecestre
&punctelev; in þat holie lijf wel &slong;tille stille
þat Þat at he wa&slong; was imaked p&rrot;io&rrot; prior of þat hous &punctelev; muche a&yogh;ein is wille

þe Þe
p&rrot;io&rrot; prior of
w&ydot;&rrot;ice&slong;tre w&ydot;ricestre
&punctelev; seint
o&slong;wold Oswold
bigan er

þat Þat
o&slong;wold Oswold bifo&rrot;e seint
wol&slong;ton Wolston
&punctelev; nei&yogh; ane hond&rrot;ed hondred &yogh;er
So þo&rrot;u&yogh; heo&rrot;e beire dede &punctelev; &slong;trong weo&rrot;k weork and hei&yogh; þare is

A&slong;e þis holie Man seint
Wol&slong;ton Wolston
&punctelev; in a t&ydot;me liet Arere
A belhous of &slong;wiþe &slong;trong swiþe strong weork &punctelev; bellen to hangu&ydot; þere
Bi ladd&rrot;en laddren cloumben up and doun &punctelev; and þat weo&rrot;k weork bitwene al bere

freum Freum
eo&rrot;þe eorþe mo þane fourti fet &punctelev; a &slong;e se al þat folk i&slong;ei&yogh; isei&yogh;

Seint wol&slong;ton &slong;tod and biheold &punctelev; hou he wa&slong; a dounward fa&slong;te
wolston Wolston stod and biheold &punctelev; hou he was a dounward faste
he He made þe &slong;igne of þe cro&yogh;z &punctelev; a&slong;e he feol toward þe grounde signe of þe cro&yogh;z &punctelev; ase he feol toward þe grounde

lg.l: þou Þou art a louerd þat wondere&slong; de&slong;t &punctelev; a&slong;e &slong;eith þe sauter wonderes dest &punctelev; ase seith þe sauter

A clerk wa&slong; bi&slong;chop after him was bischop after him
&punctelev; þat Men cleopeden ald&rrot;ed Aldred

þat Þat
&slong;eint wol&slong;ton Seint Wolston louede wel &punctelev; and he louede him al&slong;o also

Sethþ it bifel þat þe Erchebi&slong;chop Erchebischop
&punctelev; of Eu&combtildevert;wick Euerwick
wa&slong; was ded

lg.l:
And þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche bischopriche of wirice&slong;tre Wiricestre
&punctelev; vacaunt wa&slong; was and lere
Bi&slong;chop him made þe holie man &punctelev; seint Edward þe king
And a feng him in his dignete &punctelev; and tok him is &slong;taf staf and ring
his His bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche he wu&slong;te wuste wel &punctelev; and al&slong;o also is p&rrot;io&rrot;e priore
And Aforcede him to &slong;erui serui wel &punctelev; god and &slong;eint seint Marie
four Four &yogh;er he hadde bi&slong;chop bischop ibeo &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t Fulliche fiue
þo Þo seint Edward Þe holie k&ydot;ng &punctelev; wende out of þis line

Gret reuþe it wa&slong; was to al engelonde Engelonde
&punctelev; &slong;o weilawei þe &slong;tounde stounde

f&rrot; For o straunge men þere comen &slong;ethþe sethþe
&punctelev; and b&rrot;ou&yogh;ten brou&yogh;ten
enguelond Enguelond to grounde

¶
harold Harold
wa&slong; was þo ri&yogh;hte&slong;t ri&yogh;hte&slong;t e&ydot;r &punctelev; fo&rrot; non oþur þere nas
þe Þe croune he bar of Enguelonde &punctelev; &yogh;wuche &yogh;wile so it wa&slong; was
þou&yogh;te Þou&yogh;te to winne Enguelond &punctelev; þo&rrot;u&yogh; &slong;trencþe strencþe and tricherie
he He let him greiþi folk inou&yogh; &punctelev; and gret poer with nam
And with gret &slong;trentþe strentþe into þe se he him dude &punctelev; and to Enguelonde he cam
And de&slong;tru&ydot;de destru&ydot;de and nam al þat he fond &punctelev; and þat folk &slong;o&rrot;e sore aferde

¶ harold Harold
heo&rrot;de heorde herof telle &punctelev; þe king of Enguelonde

he He liet greiþie fa&slong;te is o&slong;t ost
&punctelev; a&yogh;ein him for to &slong;tonde stonde
þe Þe baronie of Enguelonde &punctelev; redi wa&slong; was wel &slong;one sone

þe Þe
weo&rrot;re weorre wa&slong; þo in Enguelonde &punctelev; deolful and &slong;trong strong inov&yogh;

¶No &slong;trencþe strencþe ne hadden þi&slong; þis
&slong;traunge straunge men &punctelev; þat were icome &slong;o so newe

A&yogh;eine&slong;t heom of enguelonde Enguelonde
&punctelev; þe &yogh;w&ydot;le hu&ydot; wolden beo trewe

þat Þat
b&rrot;ou&yogh;te brou&yogh;te þo Enguelond &punctelev; al to grounde iwis

fo&rrot; For þe
engli&slong;che Englische
barones bicomen &slong;ome some
&punctelev; on treo and fal&slong;e false
al&slong;o also
To bitrai&yogh;e heom &slong;eolf seolf and heo&rrot;e heore k&ydot;ng &punctelev; þat so muche heom truste to

¶ þis Þis
No&rrot;emauns Noremauns
and þis Engli&slong;che Englische
men &punctelev; ane dai of bataile hu&ydot; nome

þare Þare
a&slong;e ase þe Abbeie of þe bataille is &punctelev; ate da&ydot;e to gadere hu&ydot; come

To grounde hu&ydot; &slong;miten smiten and &slong;lowen slowen
al&slong;o also
&punctelev; ake ala&slong; alas þulke &slong;tounde stounde
fo&rrot; For þulke þat þe king tru&slong;te truste to &punctelev; failleden him wel fa&slong;te faste

So þat he was bineoþe bineoþe
i&rrot;ou&yogh;t i&rrot;ou&yogh;t
&punctelev; and ouercome at þe la&slong;te laste

And to grounde ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t ibrou&yogh;t and alle his &punctelev; and al Enguelond
al&slong;o also

And neuer e&slong;t est ne cam a&yogh;ein a&yogh;ein
&punctelev; to ri&yogh;hte E&ydot;re&slong; none
And nei&yogh;h &yogh;wat alle þis hei&yogh;e Men &punctelev; and of þe lo&yogh;we Al&slong;o Also

And bisette al enguelond Enguelond
&punctelev; with men of oþere londe
Neuereft to is cu&ydot;nde heritage &punctelev; ne cam it ich onder&slong;tonde

¶ þis Þis
willam William
ba&slong;tard bastard þat wa&slong; was king &punctelev; &slong;ethþe him onder&slong;tod onderstod
þat Þat he mid vnri&yogh;hte hadde i&slong;ched isched &punctelev; mani ane mannes blod
þat Þat þe Abbeie of þe bataille is icleoped &punctelev; þat wel noble &slong;tand stand &yogh;eot þere
Ake euere he heold fo&rrot;th forth þe k&ydot;nedom &punctelev; of enguelonde Enguelonde with wou&yogh;

¶Ake &slong;one sone
&slong;o so he wa&slong; was king imad &punctelev; and al enguelond Enguelond bisette

A&slong;e
he wolde with &slong;traunge men straunge men
&punctelev; and no man ne mi&yogh;hte him lette

þis Þis holie Bi&slong;chop Bischop seint
wol&slong;ton Wolston
&punctelev; wel ofte him with &slong;eide seide

þat Þat he with on ri&yogh;hte hadde ido &punctelev; a
&slong;wuch swuch luþer dede

And &slong;pat spat a&yogh;ein him baldeliche &punctelev; and ne &slong;parede sparede
fo&rrot; for no d&rrot;ede drede

fo&rrot; For he wa&slong; was þo þe cu&ydot;nde&slong;te cu&ydot;ndeste
engli&slong;che Englische
man &punctelev; þat wa&slong; was of enie manhede
And fo&rrot; for alle oþure weren de&slong;eritede deseritede nei&ydot;h &punctelev; þe king wa&slong; was with heom wrothþ

þat Þat he wa&slong; was
&slong;o so lu&ydot;te ad&rrot;ad adrad of him &punctelev; and &slong;wo&rrot; swor Anon is othþ

To pulte him out of is bi&slong;chop&rrot;op&rrot;iche bischopropriche
&punctelev; he liet &slong;omune somune
al&slong;o also

To
we&slong;tmini&slong;tre Westministre to an&slong;werien answerien him &punctelev; of þat he him hadde mi&slong;do misdo

¶Nou nas nou&yogh;t &slong;eint seint
wul&slong;ton Wulston
&punctelev; wel gret clerk in lo&rrot;e lore
fo&rrot; For þo he &slong;cholde scholde to &slong;cole scole gon &punctelev; to churche he &yogh;eode wel mo&rrot;e more

To
we&slong;tmini&slong;tre Westministre he cam to is da&ydot; &punctelev; a&slong;e he wa&slong; was
i&slong;omoned isomoned er
þe Þe king wa&slong; was in grete wrathþe &punctelev; wel p&rrot;e&slong;t prest to kepe him þer

And þe bi&slong;chop bischop
Gondolf of
Rouce&slong;tre Roucestre
&punctelev; alle to don him &slong;chame schame

Seint wol&slong;ton Wolston bi heom cam &punctelev; þat a&yogh;ein him weren &slong;o so
&slong;trongue strongue

A&slong;e þeof bifo&rrot;e bifore
Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
&punctelev; his dom to vnderfongue

¶ þe Þe king and þe Erchebi&slong;chop erchebischop
al&slong;o also
&punctelev; &slong;peken to him wo&rrot;de&slong; grete

þat Þat he &slong;cholde scholde
a&slong;e ase he wu&ydot;&rrot;þe wu&ydot;rþe
wa&slong; was
&punctelev; i&slong; bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche bischopriche lete
fo&rrot; For to holden &slong;wuch swuch dignete &punctelev; to lu&ydot;te he couþe of lo&rrot;e lore
And hu&ydot; him hadden to longue iþoled &punctelev; and þo nolden hu&ydot; non mo&rrot;e
And grete fole&slong; foles hu&ydot; weren þat &slong;wuch swuch afol &punctelev; fo&rrot;me&slong;t b&rrot;ou&yogh;te brou&yogh;te in &slong;wch swch mi&yogh;hte

¶Seint wol&slong;ton Wolston
&slong;tod stod wel mildeliche &punctelev; and herknede al þat hu&ydot; &slong;ede sede
Nadde he no man bote god &punctelev; to his an&slong;were answere him rede
Sire&slong; he &slong;eide seide ri&yogh;ht it is &punctelev; þat ich eoure he&slong;te heste do

fo&rrot; For
&slong;ire sire king þou art an &slong;ouerein souerein
&punctelev; and þe erchebi&slong;chop erchebischop
al&slong;o also

þe Þe croce ich habbe &yogh;are ibo&rrot;e ibore
&punctelev; þat &yogh;e i&slong;eothþ iseothþ here lo
Aknowe ich am wel ich wor &punctelev; þat i nam nou&yogh;t wu&ydot;&rrot;þe wu&ydot;rþe þer to
&yogh;wane &YOGH;wane &yogh;e wollez þat ich a&slong; as bileue &punctelev; a&slong;e man þat vnwurþ is
Wel fam ichulle eouwer he&slong;te heste do &punctelev; a&slong;e mine &slong;ouereine&slong; souereines iwis
vnbou&yogh;h&slong;ome Vnbou&yogh;hsome to holie churche &punctelev; iwis i nelle be nou&yogh;t

To &yogh;elden hire up a&slong;e ase &yogh;e me hotez &punctelev; ich habbe a&slong;e ase
ib&rrot;ou&yogh;t ibrou&yogh;t
þe Þe guode Man þat a&slong; as me bitok &punctelev; &yogh;eonde he lijchþ wel &slong;tille

¶To seint Edwarde&slong; toumbe he wende &punctelev; þat wa&slong; was of Marb&rrot;e Marbre
&slong;ton ston
A And nam up is croiz wel mildeliche &punctelev; and &slong;mot smot þe point þaron

þe Þe
&slong;taf staf wende into þe marb&rrot;e&slong;ton marbreston
&punctelev; a&slong;e it were in ne&slong;che nesche
&slong;onde sonde
Nou he seide ich him habbe bitake &punctelev; þat a&slong;tok astok me
And bifo&rrot;e bifore eov here &punctelev; i&yogh;ollden op dignete
Takez a&slong; nouþe &yogh;wam &yogh;e wollez &punctelev; &slong;om þat bet beo in lo&rrot;e
And habbez guod dai nouþe euerechone &punctelev; &yogh;e ne mouwen e&slong;che esche men non mo&rrot;e more

þat Þat folk &slong;tod stod
a&slong;e ase it were inome &punctelev; and biheolden þe croce wel ofte

hou Hou heo &slong;tod stod in þe Marb&rrot;e marbre
&slong;ton ston &punctelev; &slong;o
deope and &slong;o so
fa&slong;te faste
Of þe Miracle heom wond&rrot;ede wondrede alle &punctelev; and &slong;ome some Weren &slong;o&rrot;e sore agaste

Some wenden þar to &slong;one sone
&punctelev; þe croce up fo&rrot;to forto
d&rrot;awe drawe

þare Þare
na&slong; nas no &slong;o so
&slong;trong strong of heom &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;hte hire ene&slong; enes wawe

¶ þe Þe
Erchebi&slong;chop erchebischop aros him up &punctelev; to &slong;ai&slong;i saisi þe croiz anon

þe Þe
Bi&slong;chop Bischop of
Rouce&slong;tre Roucestre wel baldeliche &punctelev; þudereward gan gon
he He no mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t ene&slong; enes wawien &punctelev; þat folk wond&rrot;ede wondrede echon

And þare aboute wel þicke ornen &punctelev; þat wonder fo&rrot;to
&slong;eo seo

þo Þo þe king and þe Erchebi&slong;chop Erchebischop
i&slong;ei&yogh;en isei&yogh;en
&punctelev; þat non oþur it ne mi&yogh;hte beo

heom Heom of þou&yogh;te heo&rrot;e heore dede &punctelev; after seint wol&slong;ton Wolston
&slong;ende sende
¶ þe Þe Messagers iredie weren &punctelev; and aftur him &slong;one sone wenden
&yogh;eot &YOGH;eot þis holie Man for al þe gult &punctelev; i&slong; heo&rrot;te heorte to heom bende
And &slong;eide seide ich mot nede it do &punctelev; mine souereines wille
To court he wende a&yogh;ein to heom &punctelev; wel mildeliche and &slong;tille stille
þo Þo he wa&slong; was to court icome &punctelev; hu&ydot; arisen a&yogh;ein him þere

þe Þe king and þe Erchebi&slong;chop Erchebischop
al&slong;o also
&punctelev; and oþere þat þare were

With gret honur hu&ydot; cleopeden him fo&rrot;thþ forthþ
&punctelev; fo&rrot;&yogh;iuene&slong;&slong; him bede
And boden amendi a&yogh;ein him &punctelev; al heo&rrot;e heore grete mi&slong;dede misdede
And beden him mine a&yogh;ein is croce &punctelev; and con bi heo&rrot;e heore rede

¶Nai certe&slong; certes
&slong;ire&slong; sires quath Seint
Wol&slong;ton Wolston
&punctelev; þat nere me nou&yogh;t to do wu&ydot;&rrot;þe wu&ydot;rþe þare to
Ake nimeth &yogh;wam eower wille be &punctelev; an oþur þat conne mo&rrot;e more

þe Þe k&ydot;ng and þe Erchebischop erchebischop
al&slong;o also
&punctelev; beden him milce and o&rrot;e ore
And &slong;eiden seiden þat þere na&slong; nas non oþur &punctelev; þat &slong;o so wu&ydot;&rrot;þe were þare to
longue Longue it wa&slong; was are þis holie man &punctelev; wolde heo&rrot;e heore wille do

Ake
fo&rrot;to obeien is souerein&slong; souereins
&punctelev; he wende fo&rrot;th forth at þe la&slong;te laste

And nam þe croce wel mildeliche &punctelev; þare he &slong;tikede stikede here er
&slong;o fa&slong;te faste
¶Also li&yogh;htliche a&slong;e ase ani þing &punctelev; þe croce he gan up d&rrot;awe drawe
þat Þat so mani men fondeden er &punctelev; and ne mi&yogh;hten hire ene&slong; enes wawe

þicke Þicke
o&rrot;n orn þat folk abouten him &punctelev; and no wonder it na&slong; nas

þe Þe miracle wa&slong; was
&slong;one sone wide ikud &punctelev; þat &slong;o so apert wa&slong; was

Men anoureden þis holie Man man
&punctelev; al&slong;o muche a&slong;e ase hu&ydot; mi&yogh;hte
his His power þat him wa&slong; was er binome &punctelev; he tok a&yogh;ein with ri&yogh;hte
¶ þis Þis holie Man ladde al is lif &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe faire and clene
Sijkne&slong;&slong;es þare weren wel fewe &punctelev; þat man wolde him offe mene

þat Þat he ne b&rrot;ou&yogh;te brou&yogh;te to hele a non &punctelev; þo&rrot;u&yogh; o&rrot;e ore
louerde&slong; louerdes grace
Sike men wek þicke comen &punctelev; to him in eche place
&YOGH;wane hu&ydot; comen to him &punctelev; ou&yogh;were in am place
So longue he leouede on eo&rrot;þe eorþe here &punctelev; þat he wa&slong; was of grete elde

his His bodi bigan to heueg&ydot; &slong;wiþe swiþe
&punctelev; grete feble&slong;&slong;e feblesse he fielde
¶A slou&yogh; feuere him cam on &punctelev; þat ne nam him nou&yogh;t ful &slong;trongue strongue

Ac heo made i&slong; is bodi to melte awei &punctelev; þat la&slong;te laste
&slong;wiþe swiþe longue
Seue ni&yogh;ht bifo&rrot;e bifore þat he deide &punctelev; his b&rrot;eþren breþren he liet fette alle

And liet him alle is ri&yogh;hte&slong; ri&yogh;htes
&punctelev; and &slong;eide seide &yogh;wat heom &slong;cholde scholde bifalle
Out of þis wo&rrot;ld world to heouene he wende &punctelev; þare &slong;chal schal a&ydot; bileue

In þe Monþe monþe of Ieneuer &punctelev; a
&slong;eint seint
fabiane&slong; Fabianes
eue

¶A
þou&slong;end þousend &yogh;er and nie hund&rrot;et hundret
&punctelev; and foure þare bifo&rrot;e bifo&rrot;e

It wa&slong; was þat o&rrot;e ore
&slong;wete swete louerd &punctelev; on o&rrot;þe orþe
wa&slong; was
ibo&rrot;e ibo&rrot;e

In þe teoþe &yogh;ere al&slong;o also
&punctelev; of þe kinedom ·

l.add:
Of willam William þe rede king &punctelev; þat aftur
will&combmacr;a Willam
ba&slong;tard bastard cam ·

lg.l:
And four Monþes monþes and four dawe&slong; dawes
&punctelev; ibeo in wo&rrot;lde worlde her

four Four
&slong;co&rrot;e score &yogh;er he wa&slong; was old &punctelev; and &slong;euene seuene
al&slong;o also nei&yogh;h
Are he wende out of þis lijf &punctelev; to þe Io&ydot;e of heuene an hei&yogh;

þo Þo þis holie man wa&slong; was ded &punctelev; þe comen Monek&slong; moneks
&slong;one sone

In þe p&rrot;io&rrot;ie priorie of
wirece&slong;tre Wirecestre
&punctelev; and duden þat wa&slong; was to done
Wu&slong;chen þat bodi a&slong;e ase it wa&slong; was ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; and to churche it bere
Þe Moneke&slong; monekes alle with gret honour &punctelev; þat is b&rrot;eþerne breþerne were

þe Þe
&slong;erui&slong;e seruise abouten him hu&ydot; duden &punctelev; a&slong;e it wa&slong; was wel ri&yogh;ht

And to &slong;eggen seggen
heo&rrot;e heore
&slong;autere&slong; sauteres
al&slong;o also
&punctelev; þare bi hu&ydot; woken ani&yogh;ht
¶ þo Þo it was wel with inne ni&yogh;ht &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; &slong;eiden seiden in heo&rrot;e heore boke

heom Heom
lu&slong;te luste slepe swiþe wel &punctelev; þat vnneþe&slong; vnneþes hu&ydot; mi&yogh;hten loke
And &slong;ome some ne mi&yogh;hten nou&yogh;t furbere &punctelev; ake lei&yogh;en and slepen fa&slong;te faste
Some a&slong;e ase it were in dweolkningue &punctelev; heo&rrot;e ei&yogh;ene to gadere hu&ydot; ca&slong;te caste
þat Þat holie bodi þat lai þare ded &punctelev; among heom in þe bere
Aros up wel mildeliche &punctelev; a&slong;e þei it alive were
And a wei&yogh;hte heom euer ech on &punctelev; and bigan at þon ende

And euere a&slong;e ase he awei&yogh;hte heom &punctelev; &slong;umdel gan heom chide · he ·

þat Þat hu&ydot; nolden with heo&rrot;e heore slep &punctelev; heo&rrot;e ri&yogh;hte t&ydot;me abide

¶So muche is holi heo&rrot;te heorte
&punctelev; þe o&rrot;d&rrot;e ordre
fo&rrot; for to wite
